text: Island of Awakening from Dragon Quest Builders 2
author: Kenneth Rogers

text: For some odd reason I've never played a Dragon Quest game. Are these games disconnected from each other like Final Fantasy? If so, which one is the best to start with? I really want to get into the series.
author: Moop Bread

text:
They're pretty much disconnected. Although with that being said, Dragon Quest 1, 2, and 3 are on the same timeline (1 takes place 100 years after 3, 2 takes place 100 years after 1).
I'd recommend starting with the SFC remake of Dragon Quest III (there's a great English translation available). DQIII truly entails what Dragon Quest is all about.
Many people would also recommend starting with Dragon Quest VIII on PS2.
author: Cryptonberry

text: I made the mistake of waiting months before buying Dragon Quest V DS, it took me a long time to finally find it in stores around where I live. I'm not making the same mistake with this game so I bought it today. I actually finished the SNES version for the first time a year ago so I'll wait a bit before tackling it. I'm still putting hours and hours on DQIX anyways, so it can wait.
